alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 21 at 2:41PM AKST until January 22 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. North-northeast winds 15 to 25 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley. * WHEN...From 7 PM Sunday to 7 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A cold Arctic air mass is in place over interior Alaska through Monday night. This cold air paired with increased winds will decrease wind chill values to between 40F -and 50F -through Monday. Wind chill values will once again drop to 30F -to 40F -by Monday night. Winds will decrease into Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
